result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick E. Gengler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,083.
On Count #2: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,083.

Mr. Gengler is to pay the total, $2,166 plus attorney fees, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 1/18/16 and on the 18th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. 
Non-payment shall result in a 33 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive; can be transfered to another county so long as it is not at any additional cost to Jefferson County.
12-14-2015 - The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees of $1,085.55

Case called at 4:17pm [mo]
Defendant Rick E. Gengler in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Upon inquiry by the Court, Mr. Gengler withdraws his request for Attorney Rhiel to be withdrawn as Counsel
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Gengler 

On Count #1: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,083.
On Count #2: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,083.

Mr. Gengler is to pay the total, $2,166 plus attorney fees, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 1/18/16 and on the 18th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. 
Non-payment shall result in a 33 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive; can be transfered to another county so long as it is not at any additional cost to Jefferson County.

Any Cash Bail posted is to be applied to costs/fees 
recess:4:47pm
FINANCIAL NOTES: repayment of AFT pymnts was add addressed at 11/10/15 hrg.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:13pm [mo]
[Payment Hearing]
Rick E. Gengler does NOT appear. 
The Court reviews the Court Record

The Court issues a bench warrant, body only.
recess: 1:21pm--reconvene: 1:26pm

Mr. Gengler now appears in court
The Court inquires of Mr. Gengler of his non payment towards court appointed attorney.
Mr. Gengler indicates that he was unaware he was to pay toward his attorney fees prior to the case concluding.
Mr. Gengler indicates that he does not have the money at this time to pay what is owed toward attorney fees.
Mr. Gengler indicates that he wishes to have a new court appointed attorney, the Court directs Mr. Gengler to contact Attorney Rhiel.
The Court and Mr. Gengler have discussion regarding the repayment of attorney fees.

The Court holds in abeyance any payments until this case is resolved or otherwise directed by the Court. 
The Court notifies Mr. Gengler of upcoming hearings.
The Court quashes the previously issued warrant.
recess: 1:40pm

Case called at 2:15pm [mo]
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel appears in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Rick E. Gengler does not appear

Atty. Rhiel indicates that after the last hearing he has attempted to contact Mr. Gengler numerous times and sent Mr. Gengler an authorization to act, with no return; further he indicates that he spoke with Mr. Gengler's mother this morning and she indicated that Mr. Gengler works out of town all week and then she provided his new phone number to Atty. Rhiel. 
Atty. Rhiel requests an additional adjourned initial appearance.
DA Happ objects to further adjournment and requests a warrant. 
The Court reviews the court record.
The Court orders a bench warrant, Mr. Gengler may be released with a $500 cash bail so long as a new hearing time and date is included within the bond. 
recess: 2:21pm
Adjourned initial appearance on June 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

The Court adjourns the hearing so that Attorney Rhiel can file an Authorization to allow him to enter pleas.

Conflict review Worksheet
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:42pm. 
Defendant Rick E. Gengler in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Gengler. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Gengler verifies that he heard the Court provide information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.
After Mr. Gengler indicates that he desires counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--to go to the Jefferson Public Defenders Office this afternoon to make arrangements for applying for PD representation
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriffs Office today for booking
recess 2:47pm 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/19/15 at 2:00pm.
